file_content.text: Good to see you.
Heard there was quite a rumble in the quarantine zone. Guessing that was you.
The Imperials were behind the abductions at Club Ufora. I took out their base.
I was fighting the Empire.
Knew this whole deal was over my head, but I didn't know it was that high.
That's correct.
Sounds like whoever was making trouble for the Republic is out of business. Good.
Guess all you want.
Secret mission, huh? Fair enough.
I'll be sure to steer Republic people away from Club Ufora from now on.
Take care. If you get a chance, an old friend in the industrial zone could use someone like you. His name's Ganuk.
Saw one of the fleet officers leave Club Ufora. Hope he wasn't the only one left.
The fleet officers are in the back of Club Ufora. They need your help.
The name's Ilox. I'm a freelance private investigator. We need to talk.
Your crew looks like it can handle anything. That's good.
I understand Jedi get asked for help all the time, but this is important.
Don't know why one of the Republic's finest is here, but it's good timing.
You've got a reputation for being an enlightened sort of mercenary. Hope it's true.
Looks like you've got the tools and talent to handle big problems. Maybe you can help.
Someone from the Republic needs to know what I've stumbled onto, in case I get "disappeared."
I don't understand. Are you in some kind of danger?
You're in trouble?
Almost always--but this is different.
Don't leave me in suspense.
Beat it, you paranoid lunatic.
You decide I'm loopy, fine--first hear me out.
There's bad business going down at Club Ufora. Saw some Republic fleet officers go in, but they never came out.
I decided to snoop around. Made it to one of the back rooms. It was full of slave cages.
Why would a club need slave cages?
That's strange.
You'd be surprised what goes on here--but there's more to this.
Who hired you to follow around those Republic fleet officers?
Who do you work for?
Nobody. I'm just returning a favor.
Republic soldiers rescued me from the Empire when I was a kid. Saved my life.
I keep tabs on any Republic military that come here on shore leave. Make sure they don't get in trouble.
The Republic is lucky to have a friend like you.
That's commendable.
Wish I could do more, but this is out of my league.
Why bring me in on this?
Because I found some trouble I can't do anything about.
What a waste of effort.
My point is, I think those fleet officers are in over their heads.
Could be a coincidence.
I don't usually blink twice at that stuff, either. Plenty of places have worse. But that's not all I found.
Club Ufora has major security--way above normal. The guards are boosted with combat adrenals and cybernetic implants.
Whatever's happening, it's worth killing to keep secret. Somebody needs to rescue those officers.
Thanks for bringing this to me. I'll take it from here.
I'm that somebody.
You did the right thing, Ilox. I'll handle this.
I'm that somebody.
May the Force be with you. Heh... always wanted to say that.
Nobody puts my people in a cage and gets away with it.
I'm that somebody.
Good luck, soldier.
I'm on it--but if I don't come back, you'd better find someone to rescue me.
I'm that somebody.
If you don't come back, we're in a lot more trouble than I think. Good luck.
This is a risky mission.
I'm betting you can handle those thugs. Besides, you'll have the element of surprise.
I've done all I can. The rest is up to you.
Somebody else. [Refuse quest.]
That's a frosty attitude even for here. You must have been born on Hutta.
Let's talk in a bit, you and me.
